text: This Software Requirements Specification ( SRS ) identifies the requirements for the ASPERA - 3 Processing and Archiving Facility ( APAF ) ground data system for the Mars Express mission . <end>
The ASPERA - 3 instrument package will be flown on the Mars Express mission of the European Space Agency ( ESA ) and will be launched in June 2003 according to the current schedule . <end>
ASPERA - 3 contains a number of different sensors that will measure the particles , neutral atoms , and fields in the near Martian environment . <end>
Southwest Research Institute is providing the data system to produce data products in a form suitable for analysis and archiving . <end>
These data products will be put into a form known as the Instrument Data File Set ( IDFS ) . <end>
The ASPERA - 3 Processing and Archiving Facility ( APAF ) is a ground data system responsible for processing all of the ASPERA - 3 telemetry . <end>

Software System: The ASPERA - 3 Processing ground data system

text: The APAF data system acquires the telemetry data via NISN , processes the data into IDFS data sets , distributes the IDFS data sets to the ASPERA - 3 team , provides web - based displays of the most current data for public view , stores the telemetry and IDFS data sets on a local SwRI archive , and submits the ASPERA - 3 IDFS data sets to PDS for long - term archival . <end>
The first step in defining the IDFS data sets is to identify the physical instruments that make up the ASPERA - 3 experiment and any ancillary data necessary for scientific analysis . <end>

There are six components of the ASPERA - 3 package , plus the orbit and attitude data from the spacecraft : Data Processing Unit ( DPU ) , Electron Spectrometer ( ELS ) , Ion Mass Analyzer ( IMA ) , Neutral Particle Detector ( NPD ) , Neutral Particle Imager ( NPI ) , Scanning Unit ( SU ) , Orbit / Attitude ( OA ) . <end>
Each of the physical components will be divided into logical groups ( called virtual instruments ) in which each logical group will be formatted as an IDFS data set . <end>

Each of the seven components described above will have an associated Software Design Document ( SDD ) that will define and fully describe all of the data products contained within each individual virtual instrument . <end>

The APAF ground data system is to provide data processing algorithms and support to IRF for the ASPERA - 3 science team ( including Co - I â€™ s ) in preparation for the Mission Operations and Data Analysis ( MO & DA ) phase of the Mars Express mission . <end>

In addition , validation and archiving of all ASPERA - 3 scientific data in the NASA Planetary Data System ( PDS ) within 6 months of receipt in a form useable by the general scientific community is to be provided by the APAF . <end>

Section 2 is an overview of the descriptions of requirement determination , qualification procedures , rationale , and traceability that are used in the identification and the definitions of the requirements . <end>
The requirements of the APAF data system are categorized and defined in Section 3 . <end>
Section 4 contains general information to aid in the understanding of this specification . <end>
Each requirement shall be : assigned a project - unique identifier . <end>
The APAF ground data system requirements are categorized according to functional areas and are defined in the following sections in table format . <end>
The requirements associated with the functionality of the APAF ground data system are itemized in the table below . <end>
The mnemonic , FR , is used in the requirement identifiers to show that these requirements are Functional Requirements unless otherwise specified . <end>
The APAF system shall acquire from ESOC the telemetry data of the ASPERA - 3 Experiment and Mars Express Orbit / Attitude to automatically process the data on a daily basis . <end>
The APAF system shall process all ASPERA - 3 science data into IDFS data sets . <end>
The APAF system shall process the engineering and ancillary information necessary for calibration and science validation into IDFS data sets . <end>

Intermediate files of cleaned - up ASPERA - 3 and MEX OA telemetry shall be generated in the event that cleaned - up telemetry is not provided by ESOC to support the ASPERA - 3 team in meeting mission goals and objectives . <end>
The ASPERA - 3 and MEX OA telemetry data shall be stored on a local SwRI archive for data availability and re - processing . <end>
The ASPERA - 3 and MEX OA IDFS data sets shall be stored on a local SwRI archive for data availability and analysis . <end>

Any APAF - generated intermediate files of ASPERA - 3 and MEX OA cleaned - up telemetry shall be stored on a local SwRI archive for data availability and re - processing , and to support the ASPERA - 3 team . <end>
Web - based displays of the most current ASPERA - 3 data shall be provided for public view to monitor instrument performance . <end>

Web - based displays defined by ASPERA - 3 team shall be provided where any available ASPERA - 3 data ( as opposed to just the most current ) can be used for science analysis to support the ASPERA - 3 team in meeting mission goals and objectives . <end>

The web - based displays defined by the ASPERA - 3 team to be used for science analysis shall be password protected until the ASPERA - 3 data is made public to support the ASPERA - 3 team in meeting mission goals and objectives . <end>
The APAF ground data system shall have built - in error handling for better data integrity . <end>

System Requirements: built - in error handling for better data integrity

text: ASPERA - 3 and MEX OA IDFS data and any APAF - generated intermediate files of ASPERA - 3 and MEX OA cleaned - up telemetry shall be provided to all ASPERA - 3 Co - I â€™ s . <end>
IDFS data access software developed by SwRI shall be made available to the ASPERA - 3 Co - I â€™ s to support the ASPERA - 3 team in meeting mission goals and objectives . <end>

Science analysis software developed by SwRI to analyze IDFS - formatted data shall be made available to the ASPERA - 3 Co - I â€™ s to support the ASPERA - 3 team in meeting mission goals and objectives . <end>
All internal interfaces are left to the design . <end>
The Software Design Documents of each of the seven components ( see section 1 . 2 ) shall contain the detailed information of the internal interfaces . <end>
All internal data requirements are left to the design . <end>
The Software Design Documents of each of the seven components ( see section 1 . 2 ) shall contain the detailed information of the virtual instrument data items . <end>
There are no security requirements associated with the APAF ground data system . <end>
However , there are privacy issues related to intellectual property and sensitive information and data . <end>
The requirement associated with the privacy of the APAF ground data system is in the table below . <end>
The mnemonic , PR , is used in the requirement identifier to show that this requirement is a Privacy Requirement . <end>
The APAF system web server shall be password protected where appropriate to allow only pertinent ASPERA - 3 team members access . <end>
The requirements associated with computer resources are listed in the table below . <end>
Computer resources include computer hardware , computer software , and computer communication . <end>
The mnemonic , CR , is used in the requirement identifiers to show that these requirements are Computer resource Requirements . <end>
There shall be a UNIX - based APAF system development computer . <end>
There shall be a UNIX - based APAF system production computer with an archival system . <end>
There shall be a web server for the APAF system for web - based displays and information change . <end>
There shall be a network connection between SwRI and NISN for data transfers and distribution . <end>
The SwRI software team shall provide system maintenance and software support . <end>
The logistics - related requirements of the APAF ground data system are itemized in the following table . <end>
The mnemonic , LR , is used in the requirement identifiers to show that these requirements are Logistical <end>
SwRI shall provide APAF system maintenance . <end>
SwRI shall provide software support for the APAF system . <end>
The APAF data system requirements for delivering the ASPERA - 3 IDFS data , Mars Express Orbit / Attitude IDFS data , and software are described in the following table . <end>
The mnemonic , DR , is used in the requirement identifiers to show that these requirements are Delivery Requirements . <end>
ASPERA - 3 and MEX OA IDFS data and any APAF - generated intermediate files of ASPERA - 3 and MEX OA cleaned - up telemetry shall be provided to all ASPERA - 3 Co - I ' s . <end>

ASPERA - 3 IDFS data that are electronically distributed shall be provided to the ASPERA - 3 Co - I â€™ s within 24 hours of acquiring ASPERA - 3 telemetry as long as the transmission and processing are error - free to support the ASPERA - 3 team in meeting MEX mission goals and objectives <end>

MEX OA IDFS data that are electronically distributed shall be provided to the ASPERA - 3 Co - I â€™ s within 24 hours of acquiring MEX OA telemetry as long as the transmission and processing are error - free to support the ASPERA - 3 team in meeting MEX mission goals and objectives . <end>

Any APAF - generated intermediate files of ASPERA - 3 and MEX OA cleaned - up telemetry that are electronically distributed shall be provided to the ASPERA - 3 Co - I â€™ s within 24 hours of acquiring ASPERA - 3 and MEX OA telemetry as long as the transmission and processing are error - free to support the ASPERA - 3 team in meeting MEX mission goals and objectives . <end>
ASPERA - 3 IDFS data and MEX OA IDFS data shall be provided to NASA PDS . <end>
ASPERA - 3 data shall be provided to NASA PDS in PDS - compliant form . <end>
ASPERA - 3 data shall be calibrated and validated prior to depositing in the NASA PDS . <end>
ASPERA - 3 data shall be provided to NASA PDS no later than 6 months after acquisition . <end>
SwRI shall provide IDFS data processing algorithms to IRF . <end>
Science analysis software shall be integrated into the NASA approved data repository . <end>
IDFS data access software developed by SwRI shall be made available to the ASPERA - 3 Co - I â€™ s to support the ASPERA - 3 team in meeting mission goals and objectives . <end>

Science analysis software developed by SwRI to analyze IDFS - formatted data shall be made avaiable to the ASPERA = 3 Co - I â€™ s to support the ASPERA - 3 team in meeting mission goals and objectives . <end>
How the ASPERA - 3 and MEX OA data and exactly what data sets are to be distributed to each Co - I shall be determined by the needs and resources available six months prior to MEX launch . <end>
The distribution mechanisms shall be clearly defined / described in the APAF Operation Procedures Document . <end>
This section identifies the requirements considered but not part of the APAF ground data system requirements . <end>
The APAF data system is not required to operate in more than one state or mode . <end>
There are no installation - dependent requirements for the operation of the APAF data system . <end>
However , if any are identified , they shall be documented in the APAF Operations Procedures Document . <end>
The APAF data system will not impose hazards to personnel , property , or the environment . <end>
Therefore , there are no safety requirements of the APAF ground data system . <end>
Although the APAF data system and associated software will be developed with the highest quality possible , there are no requirements concerned with software quality . <end>

Some of the software quality factors that will be considered when developing the APAF data system include : reliability , maintainability , availability , flexibility , portability , testability , and usability . <end>
There are no requirements that constrain the design and implementation of the APAF software . <end>
There are no identified requirements related to personnel that will use the software . <end>
However , the APAF Operations Procedures Document will aid personnel in the operational use of the APAF system . <end>

Since the members of the SwRI software team are experienced with data system and IDFS processing software development , there are no training - related requirements for developers of the APAF data system . <end>

In addition , the APAF Operations Procedures Document shall provide installation and operations procedures of the APAF system in enough detail where there are no training - related requirements for users and operators of the APAF data system . <end>
There are no requirements of the APAF data system that need special treatment or consideration at this time . <end>
